thread.title: Chelsea 2-0 Hull City player ratings: Who was your man of the match at Stamford Bridge?
thread.title_full: Chelsea 2-0 Hull City player ratings: Who was your man of the match at Stamford Bridge?

author: Mike Walters
title: Chelsea 2-0 Hull City player ratings: Who was your man of the match at Stamford Bridge?
text:
Chelsea overcame a resilient Hull to win 2-0 (Photo: Reuter) Share Get Chelsea   
Diego Costa made a goalscoring return as Chelsea extended their lead at the top of the Premier League to eight points with a 2-0 win over Hull. 
Costa celebrated his 52nd Chelsea goal on his 100th appearance by gesturing about all the noise which has surrounded him since missing the win at Leicester, officially due to a back injury. 
A reported bust-up with Antonio Conte and his staff, as well as speculation over a move to the Chinese Super League, had little impact on Costa, whose 15th goal of the season was followed by a Gary Cahill header. 
Conte said he was willing to "put my hands in the fire" for Costa, who was cheered at every opportunity. No-one in Chelsea blue was publicly questioning his loyalty. Diego Costa celebrates with team -mates after scoring the opener (Photo: Reuters) Read More Chelsea 2-0 Hull City: Diego Costa scores on return as Blues tighten grip at top of table - 5 things we learned 
And the faith was justified with a goal on a near-ideal weekend for Chelsea. 
Rivals Liverpool, Manchester City, Tottenham and Manchester United all dropped points on Saturday and Arsenal narrowly avoided doing so on Sunday. 
Our man Mike Walters was at Stamford Bridge, here are his player ratings... Gary Cahill jumps to head past Eldin Jakupovic (Photo: AFP/Getty) PLAYER RATINGS 
Courtois 7 - Safe as houses: bricks, mortar, chimney stack and the garden path. 
Azpilicueta 7 - Tidier than Alan Titchmarsh's garden, his versatility is such an asset. 
Luiz 7 - Took no prisoners, especially Clucas in one uncompromising collision. 
Cahill 8 – MOM Early crack on the head then popped up unmarked to make it 2-0. 
Moses 7 - Fast and direct, his incisive cut-back broke Hull's resistance. 
Kante 6 - Booked. Swapped relegation battle at Leicester for another title charge: good decision. Hull City line up to defend a free kick (Photo: PA) 
Matic 7 - Classier than tea at the Ritz, tougher than a marble staircase. 
Alonso 6 - Classier than dinner at the Savoy but lucky not to concede penalty. 
Pedro 5 - Not quite at the races, like a non-runner in the 2.30 at Haydock. 
Hazard 7 - Span away from defenders like a tumble dryer before injury took its toll. 
Costa 7 - All sins forgiven, it had to be him who broke the deadlock. 
SUBS: Willian (Pedro, 71) 6, Fabregas (Hazard, 71) 6, Batshuayi (Costa, 86). Eden Hazard in action with David Meyler (Photo: REUTERS) 
HULL CITY 
Jakupovic 6 - Strange but true: for long periods he was the quieter keeper. 
Elabdellaoui 7 - Decent debut from Norwegian wing-back, mobile and positive. 
Maguire 8 – Believe it or not, Hull's most threatening player when he rampaged forward. 
Davies 6 - Booked. Resolute, robust and lucky not be sent off in first-half stoppage time. 
Dawson 6 - Booked. Immense in the air but only lost Costa once and it proved costly. Curtis Davies talks to referee Neil Swarbrick   
Robertson 6 - Booked. Had his hands full keeping Moses on a short leash. 
Mason 6 - Carried off after sickening clash of heads with Cahill. Get well soon. 
Huddlestone 6 - Just wide from early sighter, roamed middle of park diligently. 
Clucas 6 - All over the place, like Rod Stewart doing the Scottish Cup draw. Ryan Mason was taken off with a head injury   
Evandro 5 - Foraged and ferreted for space between the lines but space was limited. 
Hernandez 6 - Chopped down by Alonso, another huge penalty call favours the 'big' club. 
SUBS: Meyler (Mason, 21) 6, Niasse (Davies, 60) 4, Diomande (Hernandez, 75) 5. 
REFEREE: Neil Swarbrick.
